p: Under acute infections, such as COVID-19, glutamine consumption rate by immune cells increases, especially in rapidly dividing cells of the immune cells. Thus, glutamine supplementation in critically ill patients is necessary ( Cruzat et al., 2018). Finally, the activation of vitamin D nuclear receptor (VDR) by 1,25(OH)2D3 (calcitriol, the active form of vitamin D) is found to enhance both the innate and adaptive immune response ( Wang et al., 2004). This can be very important in cases of infectious diseases in the elderly, such as COVID-19, where the patient is probably suffering from exhausted vitamin D.
